_header: The god Cupid and Venus the goddess
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, Cupid’s Letters-patent to the author, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 13) — an opening three-line stanza and thirteen monorhyming quatrains

BLHar682.First Lines: THe god Cupide and venus the goddesWhiche power han on all worldly gladnes…
BLHar682.Last Lines: …As in the Castell of humbille desereAs for the tyme oure counsell holdyng here
